results.title: Paul Tortelier: the cello. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Film and Recording Group and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Opens with a brief recapitulation of the history of the instrument. Paul Tortelier with four cellists from the National Youth Orchestra plays the opening of Rossini’s William Tell Overture. The chamber works of Schumann and Brahms are discussed and Tortelier gives insights into how he combines skill, artistry and musicianship as he plays his own Toccata.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Film and Recording Group and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: Paul Tortelier: the cello. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Film and Recording Group and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Paul Tortelier, the French cellist and composer, conducts a master-class of four members of the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain and instructs them in some of the finer points in the Dvorak Cell Concerto. Tortelier gives a history of cello playing and the film ends with an excerpt from the great Cello Concerto by Lalo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Film and Recording Group and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: The Bassoon
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
The history and technique of the bassoon are explained by Archie Camden, one of the world’s most renowned players of the bassoon. He explains the complex fingering, and demonstrates intonation, staccato playing and trills. Ends with Camden’s famous arrangement of ‘Allegro Spiritoso’ by Senaille.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.description:

results.title: Eastern victory
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “War in the Air”.
The three further phases of the air war in the Far East (1943-45). First, the air campaign in Burma. Second, the Pacific air actions leading to the bombing of Tokyo; the third, the atomic bomb, the surrender of Japan, and the resumption of air traffic in the Far East.
results.description:

results.title: The Cold dawn
results.creator_credit: John Elliot, Air Ministry and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “War in the Air”.
Part 12 of a 15-part series telling the story of air power and its impact on the world specially compiled by the BBC in 1954-55, 90% of which comes from actual combat material. The remainder consists of extracts from war documentary films and sequences constructed and shot by BBC Production Unit with the co-operation and advice of the services. This part centres on the Winter and Spring of 1944-45 when the ring around Germany begins to tighten.
results.description:

results.title: Facing new weapons
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot, Air Ministry and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “War in the Air”.
This series of films, telling of the story of air power and its impact on the world was specially compiled by the BBC in 1954-55, 90% from actual combat material. The remainder consists of extracts from war documentary films and sequences constructed and specially shot by the BBC Production Unit with the co-operation and advice of the services. This episode focuses on air operations in Western Europe summer and autumn 1944.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “War in the Air”.
A series of films telling of the story of air power and its impact on the world during WWII compiled by the BBC and using extracts from war documentary films and sequences constructed and specially shot by BBC Production Unit with the co-ooperation and advice of the services. This episode covers the air plan for the re-entry into north-west Europe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Dorte, John Elliot, Air Ministry and BBC-TV

results.title: Wings over Italy
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “War in the Air”.
This episode deals with the air campaign of Italy from July 1943 to July 1944.
